name: George Washington
notes: North Carolina ratified the US Constitution 1789
Rhode Island ratified the US Constitution 1790

name: George Washington
notes: Construction of the original six frigates of the United States Navy were authorized 1794
11th amendment enacted (dealing with each state’s sovereign immunity) 1795

name: Thomas Jefferson
notes: An electoral tie between Thomas Jefferson and Aaron Burr was resolved when Jefferson was elected President and Burr Vice President by the House of Representatives 1801

name: Thomas Jefferson
notes: Aaron Burr killed Alexander Hamilton in a duel 1804
12th amendment enacted (procedure by which the President and V.P. are elected) 1804

name: James Madison
notes: Importation of slaves into the U.S. banned 1808

name: John Quincy Adams
notes: No candidates recieved a majority of the electoral vote. Top three were chosen to be voted on by The House of Representatives which voted on John Quincy Adams. Adams got 13 / 25 (54%) votes in the House

name: Abraham Lincoln
notes: West Virginia admitted as the 35th state 1863

name: Ulysses S. Grant
notes: 14th amendment enacted (citizenship, civil rights, apportionment of Representatives, participants in rebellion, validity of public debt, power of enforcement) 1868
15th amendment enacted (prohibition of denying a citizen the right to vote base on that citizen’s race, color, or previous condition of servitude) 1870

name: Benjamin Harrison
notes: North Dakota admitted as the 39th state 1889
South Dakota admitted as the 40th state 1889

name: Woodrow Wilson
notes: New Mexico admitted as the 47th state 1912
16th amendment enacted (allows Congress to levy an income tax) 1913
17th amendment enacted (Senators will be voted by the people of each state and not the state legislature) 1913

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
notes: Hattie Caraway becomes the first woman elected to the United States Senate 1932
20th amenmend enacted (establishes the beginning and ending of the terms of the elected federal officials) 1933

name:
Franklin D. Roosevelt
Harry S. Truman
notes: Atomic bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki 1945

name: Harry S. Truman
notes: Racial Segregation in the US Armed Forces ended 1948
22nd Amendment enacted (limits the number of terms for the President) 1951

name:
John F. Kennedy
Lyndon B. Johnson
notes: 23rd amendment enacted (representation of Washington D.C. in the electoral college) 1961
24th amendment enacted (prohibition of restricting voting rights due to non-payment of poll taxes) 1964

name: Lyndon B. Johnson
notes: 25th amendment enacted (deals with succession to the Presidency) 1967

name:
Richard Nixon
Gerald Ford
notes: End of US involvement in Vietnam War 1973

name: Bill Clinton
notes: 27th amendment enacted (increses and decreases in Congressional salaries can only take effect at the beginning of the next term of office for Representatives) 1992

name: Barack Obama
notes: First African American to be sworn in as President of the U.S.A. 2008
Operation Neptune Spear - killing of Osama bin Laden 2011
